intro: Hypoestes capitata, commonly known as the "Magic Bells" or "Snow on the Sahara," is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, showy bracts that resemble tiny bells. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, featuring upright stems and opposite, ovate leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered in terminal inflorescences, often surrounded by colorful, modified leaves called bracts. Hypoestes capitata is well-suited for container gardening and is popular for its ornamental value in both indoor and outdoor settings.
